org.opends.quicksetup.ui

Class QuickSetup

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.quicksetup.ui.QuickSetup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ButtonActionListener, ProgressUpdateListener

    public class QuickSetup
extends Object
implements ButtonActionListener, ProgressUpdateListener
    This class is responsible for doing the following:

    • Check whether we are installing or uninstalling.
    • Performs all the checks and validation of the data provided by the user during the setup.
    • It will launch also the installation once the user clicks on 'Finish' if we are installing the product.

        public QuickSetup()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(TempLogFile tempLogFile,
                       String[] args)
        This method creates the install/uninstall dialogs and to check the current install status. This method must be called outside the event thread because it can perform long operations which can make the user think that the UI is blocked.
        Parameters:
        tempLogFile - temporary log file where messages will be logged.
        args - for the moment this parameter is not used but we keep it in order to (in case of need) pass parameters through the command line.

      • display

        public void display()
        This method displays the setup dialog. This method must be called from the event thread.

      • buttonActionPerformed

        public void buttonActionPerformed(ButtonEvent ev)
        ButtonActionListener implementation. It assumes that we are called in the event thread.
        Specified by:
        buttonActionPerformed in interface ButtonActionListener
        Parameters:
        ev - the ButtonEvent we receive.

      • progressUpdate

        public void progressUpdate(ProgressUpdateEvent ev)
        ProgressUpdateListener implementation. Here we take the ProgressUpdateEvent and create a ProgressDescriptor that will be used to update the progress dialog.
        Specified by:
        progressUpdate in interface ProgressUpdateListener
        Parameters:
        ev - the ProgressUpdateEvent we receive.
        See Also:
        runDisplayUpdater()

      • quit

        public void quit()
        Method called when we want to quit the setup (for instance when the user clicks on 'Close' or 'Quit' buttons and has confirmed that (s)he wants to quit the program.

      • launch

        public void launch()
        Launch the QuickSetup application Open DS.

      • setCurrentStep

        public void setCurrentStep(WizardStep step)
        Set the current step. This will basically make the required calls in the dialog to display the panel that corresponds to the step passed as argument.
        Parameters:
        step - The step to be displayed.

      • getDialog

        public QuickSetupDialog getDialog()
        Get the dialog that is displayed.
        Returns:
        the dialog.

                         org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage title)
        Displays an error message dialog.
        Parameters:

        title - the title for the dialog.

      • displayConfirmation

        public boolean displayConfirmation(org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage msg,
                                   org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage title)
        Displays a confirmation message dialog.
        Parameters:
        msg - the confirmation message.
        title - the title of the dialog.
        Returns:
        true if the user confirms the message, or false if not.

      • getFieldStringValue

      • displayFieldInvalid

        public void displayFieldInvalid(FieldName fieldName,
                                boolean invalid)
        Marks the fieldName as valid or invalid depending on the value of the invalid parameter. With the current implementation this implies basically using a red color in the label associated with the fieldName object. The color/style used to mark the label invalid is specified in UIFactory.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field name object.
        invalid - whether to mark the field valid or invalid.
